description:
You've started the Codecademy and Coursera courses; you've thumbed
through Zed Shaw's "Learn Python the Hard Way"; and now you're itching
to see what Python can help you do. This is the workshop for you!

Here's the breakdown: we're going to be taking you on a whirlwind tour
of Python's capabilities. By the end of the workshop, you should be able
to easily follow any of the widely available Python courses on the
internet, and have a grasp on some of the more complex aspects of the
language.

Please don't forget to bring your personal laptop!

Audience: This course is aimed at those who already have some basic
programming experience, either in Python or in another high level
programming language (such as C/C++, Fortran, Java, Ruby, Perl, or
Visual Basic). If you're an absolute beginner -- new to Python, and new
to programming in general -- make sure to check out the "Python 101"
workshop!

title: Python 101++: Let's Get Down to Business
